nodes.text: The ISD Dark Omen was an Imperial I-class Star Destroyer that served in the 7th Fleet of the Imperial Navy under Grand Admiral Thrawn. The Dark Omen participated in the Battle of Atollon against the Alliance to Restore the Republic under the command of Captain Corf Ferno. The Dark Omen was slightly damaged by BTL-A4 Y-wing assault starfighter/bombers from Green Squadron during the battle above Atollon. Along with conducting an orbital bombardment of Chopper Base, the Dark Omen engaged rebel ships as they escaped through a gap between it and the Chimaera.

The Dark Omen was an Imperial I-class Star Destroyer. As such, it measured at 1,600 meters long and was outfitted four port and four starboard octuple turbolaser barbettes, ventral turbolasers, sublight engines, a hangar bay, two deflector shield generator domes, and a solar ionization reactor. Additionally, the Dark Omen was equipped with a hyperdrive system, specifically a class 2 primary and a class 8 backup. The Dark Omen was also stocked with a tractor beam targeting array situated above the starship's bridge and between the two deflector shield domes.
Onset of the Battle of Atollon

The Dark Omen served in the Galactic Empire as part of the Imperial Navy during the Galactic Civil War. By the time of the Lothal campaign, the Dark Omen was under the command of Captain Corf Ferno as part of Grand Admiral Thrawn's 7th Fleet. After Grand Admiral Thrawn pinpointed the location of the Rebel Alliance's Chopper Base on Atollon, Thrawn dispatched a squadron of five Imperial I-class Star Destroyers from Lothal to Atollon under Admiral Kassius Konstantine's command, including Captain Ferno's Dark Omen, which was the lead destroyer. The Star Destroyers were accompanied by two Arquitens-class command cruisers.

With the arrival of Imperial forces at the Atollon system, Phoenix Cell and Massassi Group scrambled to evacuate their base of operations and disperse their fleet. Alliance Commander Jun Sato ordered Phoenix fleet forces to employ Defense Formation Aurek One, while General Jan Dodonna of Massassi Group ordered his EF76 Nebulon-B escort frigates to jump into hyperspace. The frigates were prevented from doing so with the arrival of two Interdictor-class heavy cruisers until Thrawn's flagship, the Chimaera, arrived.

After Thrawn and the Chimaera's arrival, one of Massassi Group's frigates, which had been disabled by the gravity well projectors of the 7th Fleet's Interdictors, was destroyed by Konstantine's Interdictor cruiser. Eventually, rebel forces deployed their starfighter squadrons and rearranged their vessels into a spearhead formation, with frigates and corvettes defending the transports. As a result of rebel maneuvers, Grand Admiral Thrawn ordered his ships to deploy TIE fighters and to reinforce the center of their formation. Captain Hera Syndulla ordered Phoenix Squadron to clear the Imperial fighters while she commanded Green Squadron to attack the lead destroyer, the Dark Omen.

After Phoenix Squadron cleared a path, a contingent of Green Squadron BTL-A4 Y-wing assault starfighter/bombers broke through Imperial lines and made a run for the Dark Omen. "Green Leader" ordered the bombers to arm their proton torpedoes and to follow him during the bombing run, after which the BTL Y-wing starfighters managed to fly over the Dark Omen's dorsal hull and release a total of four warheads, causing three sizeable explosions. The rebel bombers then moved to the ship's portside to conduct another bombing pass, but were forced to break off when one of their bombers were destroyed by attacking TIE fighters and the Dark Omen's port batteries. Overall, the Dark Omen was lightly damaged by Green Squadron.

As the Rebel Alliance continued to suffer heavy losses in the initial attempts to break through the Imperial blockade, Commander Sato sacrificed himself and his flagship, the Quasar Fire-class cruiser-carrier Phoenix Nest, by drawing out Admiral Konstantine's Interdictor out of position and colliding directly. This action destroyed both vessels and allowed the Jedi Lieutenant Commander Ezra Bridger to escape and summon reinforcements. Following Sato's sacrifice and additional losses, rebel forces fled to the surface of Atollon. Thrawn reorganized his formation, and all of his Star Destroyers launched an orbital bombardment of Chopper Base to break rebel morale, but the deflector shield generator held firm.

After a ground assault by Thrawn to capture the rebel leadership and the destruction of the Interdictor cruiser Constrainer by Mandalorian reinforcements brought by Bridger, the last remaining rebel ships fled Atollon's surface and moved towards the Imperial blockade. The rebels ships pushed through a gap between the Chimaera and the Dark Omen. Although several rebel ships, including a CR90 corvette, were destroyed in this final push, the remaining rebel ships escaped the blockade and jumped into hyperspace.

The Dark Omen first appeared in "Zero Hour," the third season finale of the animated TV series Star Wars Rebels. The episode was released on March 25, 2017. The 2021 reference book Star Wars: Battles that Changed the Galaxy identifies the Star Destroyer as the Dark Omen.
